Brand Voice Guidelines — Test Fixture

Section 1: Voice & Tone
- Always use active voice, never passive voice.
- Keep sentences under 25 words where possible.
- Write at a grade 8 reading level.
- Avoid jargon unless writing for a technical audience.

Section 2: Banned Phrases
- Do not use "click here" — use descriptive link text instead.
- Do not use "synergy" or "leverage" in marketing copy.
- Avoid superlatives like "best", "greatest", "number one" unless backed by data.

Section 3: Formatting
- Use sentence case for headings (not Title Case or ALL CAPS).
- Limit paragraphs to 3-4 sentences.
- Use bullet points for lists of 3+ items.

Section 4: Accessibility
- All images must have alt text.
- Link text must be descriptive (no "click here", "read more").
- Color should not be the only way to convey information.

Section 5: Brand-Specific
- Always refer to the company as "Example Corp" (not "the company" or "we").
- Product names should be capitalized: ExampleProduct, ExampleService.
- Customer testimonials must include name and role.
